title.narrative: UN Team of Experts, Office of the SRSG for Sexual Violence in Conflict

description.narrative: Strengthening rule of law to ensure criminal accountability for perpetrators of conflict-related sexual violence (CRSV) in conflict-affected developing countries

organisation.narrative: Permanent Mission of Denmark to the United Nations, New York, USA

mailing-address.narrative: Chrysler East Building, 666 Third Avenue, 11th Floor

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative:
Output 1: Political will to promote accountability for CRSV at national, regional, and international levels enhanced.
Output 2: Technical and operational capacity of national rule of law institutions and actors to address accountability for CRSV enhanced.

Output 1: Indicator A: Percentage of peace operation mandates for which the Team of Experts has advocated the inclusion of the promotion of accountability for CRSV. Indicator B: Percentage of joint communiqués and frameworks of cooperation adopted by the respective Member States that includes a request for Team of Experts technical and operational support.
Output 2: Indicator: Number of assessment reports per year on accountability for CRSV prepared by the Team of Experts.

target.value:
Target 1: 100% of peace operation mandates for which the Team of Experts has advocated the inclusion of the promotion of accountability for CRSV.
Target 2: >90% of joint communiqués and frameworks of cooperation agreed between the OSRSG-SVC and the respective Member State that includes a request for Team of Experts technical and operational support.
Target 3: >2 assessment reports per year on accountability for CRSV prepared by the Team of Experts.

Target 1: 100% of peace operation mandates for which the Team of Experts has advocated the inclusion of the promotion of accountability for CRSV.
Target 2: >90% of joint communiqués and frameworks of cooperation agreed between the OSRSG-SVC and the respective Member State that includes a request for Team of Experts technical and operational support.
Target 3: >2 assessment reports per year on accountability for CRSV prepared by the Team of Experts.

Target 1: 100% of peace operation mandates for which the Team of Experts has advocated the inclusion of the promotion of accountability for CRSV.
Target 2: >90% of joint communiqués and frameworks of cooperation agreed between the OSRSG-SVC and the respective Member State that includes a request for Team of Experts technical and operational support. Target 3: >2 assessment reports per year on accountability for CRSV prepared by the Team of Experts.

title.narrative: Greater accountability for CRSV through prompt, effective and victim sensitive criminal proceedings carried out in line with international standards.

Given the complex nature and diverse contexts in which the Team of Experts works, relevant, consistent and reliable data is generally not available and few if any global indices track criminal proceedings in these countries, which makes this information highly difficult and resource-intensive to obtain. Therefore, the Team of Experts proposes to utilize information from its identified outputs and country level reporting to prepare a short qualitative assessment at the outcome level of its progress in contributing to greater accountability for CRSV through prompt, effective and victim-sensitive criminal proceedings carried out in line with international standards.

target.value: Greater accountability for CRSV through prompt, effective and victim sensitive criminal proceedings carried out in line with international standards.
